explains: adj. 马拉的（车）；用马拖的

sentences.en: Around 1910 motorized carriages were beginning to replace horse-drawn cabs.
sentences.cn: 大约一九一零年，装有发动机的四轮车开始取代马车。

sentences.en: The first type of fan, known as Shanhan, was tied to a horse-drawn carriage to shut out the strong sunshine and shelter the passengers from the rainfall.
sentences.cn: 第一种扇子叫作“扇汗”，是拴在马车上用来挡住强烈的阳光，给乘客遮雨的。

sentences.en: Sam entered a world of iceboxes, horse-drawn buggies and, commonly, outhouses.
sentences.cn: 山姆进入一个世界是有冰箱，马拉手推车或更普通的外围建筑的世界。
